answers.answer: Hello,Without being able to review your entire history it will not be possible to give you an exact answer, but generally speaking the probability of a chest pain to be related to the heart depends on the characteristics of the pain and the risks factors of the patient (age, gender, smoking, cocaine use, family history of heart attack at young age), diabetes or high blood sugar, high cholesterol and high blood pressure. First of all, from the information that you provided is possible that you have pre-hypertension (early high blood pressure) that can be related to your weight (your body surface area is 33 and normal is <25), so you should check that with your physician. About the chest pain is hard to answer the question without knowing the characteristics of the pain, but the fact that you have the pain everyday and all the studies are negative so far, decrease significantly the chances that the pain is related to the heart. There are other possible explanations for chest pain, like spasms of the esophagus, acid reflux to the esophagus from the stomach or pain from the chest wall as an example.I suggest you to address the anxiety problem with your doctor and see if the symptoms decrease after lowering the stress levels.Good luck.

question: i'm a 33yr old male.  5'11 240lbs.  good physical health, have yearly physicals.  cholestoral good but blood preesure a little high 130/84-140/90.  i had a panic attack about 3 months ago and have been having health anxiety ever since.  i've been having daily chest and back tightness.  i swear its my heart.  had 3ekg, 24hr holter , blood work, chest x ray, and a stress echo.  all came back normal.  my doc says these symptoms are a result of my anxiety not my heart.  does this make sense?  is there any way it could still be my heart?
title: chest and back tightness
